title: Typography powerpoint presentation
content:
Last week, the typography team at Target was asked to give a presentation to a segment of the corporation. We had a lot of fun and wonderful feedback from our co-workers. It was a great way to show the unitiated what a real-life typesetter/typographer does. I thought I'd share just a portion of our presentation here. We took our lead from Ellen Lupton's "Type Crimes" concept from her [Thinking with Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424141053/http:/www.papress.com/thinkingwithtype/index.htm) book.

You can see some of the slides we created [**here**](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424141053/http:/ravenmn-typographypowerpoint.buzznet.com/user/photos/)
author: kristin

comments.content: And I'm sure that it was a powerpoint presentation that Tufte would be proud of. I wonder if target would have appreciated Tschichold's description of orphans & widows... (whores' children & cobblers' apprentices). I don't remember which was which, but you can use your imagination!
Funny _and_ educational! I'm sharing this with my co-workers; they'll love it. Thanks for the link!

Good job, Kristin!  
Here's a link to a [type misdemeanor](http://web.archive.org/web/20120424141053/http:/www.acmedigital.net/images/Wanted_autokern.png) of yours! =0

No fines, you just get a warning this time ;-)
